name: The Sentosa, A Beaufort Hotel

reviews.text: Our stay was disappointing. There is nothing wrong with the hotel, and we really liked the peacocks wandering around in the gardens, but the hotel is second tier. There are just nicer, newer hotels with better service on offer for the same price in Sentosa.
reviews.title: There are much better hotels in Sentosa

reviews.text: The decor is getting dated and I didn't like how dark the decor in our room was.
reviews.title: Great swimming pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concierge service was hit and miss in terms of being good or very poor. I found the attitude of the reception staff average to poor. There were not enough staff on front desk, for example I had to stand in reception for 15 minutes while I waited for someone to serve me; I needed to get my room key recoded as it wasn't working. My son and I had been in the pool so we were standing there wet and in towels/ robes. This was not an experience I would want to repeat, not would I expect in a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Sejour in Sentosa

reviews.text: We loved staying here.
reviews.title: A peaceful relaxing hotel - away from hustle and bustle of city

reviews.text: Very comfortable and well appointed rooms.
reviews.title: pathetic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed in central Singapore for the Formula 1 weekend, and stayed here for a couple of nights to chill out at the end of our stay. I thought the hotel was beautiful, very elegant and refined, I would say this is a hotel for adults looking to get away from the buzz of the city, but don't want to be among the theme parks of Sentosa. We had booked a standard room, which was huge - entrance lobby, large king size bed which had the most luxurious mattress topper I've ever slept on with lovely soft pillow (it felt like I was in a cocoon), large bathroom with bathtub/sink, separate WC cubicle and shower cubicle - and very nice and plentiful products!
reviews.title: Elegant, tranquil haven

reviews.text: Hotel is low rise and widely spread out, all open with fans, peacocks wandering around the beautiful pool and grounds, pools with coi carp. The Pavilion bar is lovely with comfortable sofas, etc, not cheap but again very elegant. Not somewhere you want to socialise for a whole evening, but lovely for a couple of drinks/cocktails.
reviews.title: Second time at The Sentosa

reviews.text: The first night we ate in the Terrace Restaurant and went for the steak buffet deal, which was very good value. Choice of salad/soup from the buffet then they bring steak to you (which was very nice and pertectly cooked) with choice of 2 sides & one sauce, then dessert from the buffet. Only downside was that although they said this was served until 10:30pm at 10:00pm the staff were trying to hurry us to take dessert as they were about to close. They wanted to/and did once we'd taken desserts, start to clear the buffet to prepare for breakfast. We did feel a bit rushed and "in the way" which was a pity. Also bottles of wine are pretty expensive, which is typical in Singapore, but a couple of the less expensive ones weren't available and they tried to get us to go for a more expensive one, which I wasn't so impressed with.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sentosa is lovely, even though it's rather manufactured, with shuttle trams and buses throughout the day and into the evening. There is not a lot near the hotel, long wooden steps from the hotel down to the beach road (which closes at 9pm) and it seems that places are only open during the day. There was an Indian restaurant which we asked about on the 2nd day and were told last orders were at 8.30pm - we went at 8pm and they said it was closed. When we complained they did let us stay in the bar area and they did serve us dinner, but again it was rather rushed (main courses arrived about a minute after the starters!) and we felt a nuisance. I don't know where people go to eat/socialise in the evening, maybe Siloso Beach bars/restaurants stay open later as there is more there? We didn't want to stay at the hotel all the time.
reviews.title: A place to relax

reviews.text: We did have a problem with the TV operation on the 2nd night, and called reception. They took some time - had to call 40mins later and after that someone did come and rectified the problem. I would have expected a more speedy response.
reviews.title: Great to get away from the city
Great hotel with some buts......
reviews.text: Let's start with the positives. Location of the hotel is very good, friendly staff willing to help and support, pick up and return to the airport was good. They have a shuttle service every half hour to Vivocity (very large mall with shops and restaurants) as well as to the Paragon (Singapore Orchard Road). Rooms are perfect with a good bed and a great shower. However we had the feel that they cut back on people. Staff was friendly and helpful, but not enough staff to keep things going (or not well organised?). At the pool they good have made more money if they would just come by every now and then to ask for another order, at the terrace restaurant tables were not cleaned on time or made up in full, coffee milk, sugar missing, no napkins and so on. Again the staff was doing their utmost best to keep up, but needed more hands on board.... Something you would not expect from a five star........ Keep in mind as well that the hotel is not that close to the beach. You need to go down the stairs at the pool and walk for another 5 minutes to reach the beach. Turn right down the stairs if you are looking for a beach chair. These are not complimentary. Need to rent them, so better stay at the hotel pool. Overall our stay was very good but not excellent as you hope to get booking a five star!

We arrived 14 Sept 13 on way to Europe as a stopover and had a great time. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Especially the pool staff and the concierge. Can't remember the guys name on the pool bar but he was really terrific. The rooms were fantastic and we really loved the breakfast. Whatever your taste you would find there. They even make you omelettes on request. We had a great time and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Sentosational!

reviews.text: The property is located in a lovely tranquil location of the island of Sentosa. Rooms are adequately furnished with standard amenities- only negative thing to say was the well-used & worn down furniture. There were 3 adults & 2 children staying in adjoining deluxe suite king & deluxe room twin rooms- would recommend this convenient arrangement for extended families! Room service was a real pleasant surprise- food servings were very reasonably sized & served nice & warm. Food quality was good. Overall, we had a very enjoyable & relaxing 2 night stay here which served as an excellent break from the daily hustle & bustle of city life.
reviews.title: Wonderful location far away from the bustling crowds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Sentosa for the Formula 1 weekend and recommend it highly, this was our second stay and we really did not want to leave. Resort is located away from the new tourist focused action around Universal Studios which is the first plus. It has that traditional low rise resort feel centred around a large "warm" pool. Yes, the hotel is showing its age but very gracefully. Everything you need is here including choice of 3 restaurants of different styles, prices are Singapore standard - expect to pay 18SGD for each of the many cocktails you should indulge in... Hotel runs shuttle buses everywhere you need to go and Sentosa has multiple beach transport options if you dont feel like walking. Took advantage of the good quality tennis courts and free bike hire. Service was generally very good, came across one unhappy staff member who did spoil the feel one night during the stay but hey we all get grumpy at times and management has responded well to that feedback.. Great place, will be back!!
reviews.title: Extremely relaxing!

reviews.text: Second time around within a year and even better than the first trip.
reviews.title: 2nd time round and even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used to stay here a few years ago, mostly for the Spa. Came back and the experience was not up to par. The property has seen better days, this is reflected in the quality of the finishings in the room. This is fine, and can be overlooked as the property is in a nice location, however when I came into my room, I noticed the room had not been cleaned properly, there was sticky substance on the remote like gum or something. I went into the bed and within 30 seconds was covered in ants and insects. There were about 30-40 ants all over the bed. It was an infestation.
reviews.title: Aging Property, Unhelpful Staff, Unsanitary Rooms -- Not 5*

reviews.text: After informing the front desk, they said they would send somebody to take my bags and change the room. I asked somebody to come see it as I honestly could not believe what just happened. I waited over 40 min. Nothing happened, nobody came. I informed front desk I would go have dinner and then come back if they could move my bags.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to conceirge and asked what he recommended for restaurants in the area, he said nothing else was open and I should eat at the hotel. We at the main restaurant, there were no staff to welcome us, we had to go in the kitchen to find somebody and were the only ones in the restaurant. The food was sub par.
reviews.title: Sentosa stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the meal, I went to reception and it was a different person at the desk, different shifts. Not only did the next person not know of the situation, nothing had been done. After explaining he issued me a new key, and I had to move my luggage myself all the way across the hotel to another wing. I did not get an upgrade, no apology, no compensation. Nothing. Needless to say I checked out the next day. This is not an acceptable way to treat a returning guest.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and to top it off the remote control in the new room did not have any batteries so I could not watch tv... I also explained what happened in a review to management and have not had any response. Seems they really do not care about guest experiences.
reviews.title: Quiet and comfortable stay with romantic setting

description: Perched high atop a cliff amid landscaped tropical gardens, The Sentosa, A Beaufort Hotel on Singapore’s Sentosa Island is one of Asia’s best kept secrets. It is a stylish, tranquil sanctuary with superb facilities and designer guestrooms in 27 acres of lush greenery, just 10 minutes’ drive from the business district. The Sentosa, A Beaufort Hotel has 174 deluxe rooms, 37 suites and four exclusive villas. Koi-filled ponds welcome guests through corridors to the East and West wings. The rooms exude a luxurious and warm welcoming feel with plush interior and contemporary comfort.
